pr_title: Adding support for handling manipulation of multiple NameValuePairs

timeline.bodyText: @thc202 @kingthorin was planning to have another base class for usecases where scanrule wants to modify multiple name value pairs which is a use case for FileUpload scan rule. WDYT ?
timeline.author: preetkaran20

replies.bodyText: Wouldn’t file upload use the multipart variant which can already handle manipulation of various elements? (File name, disposition, content type)
replies.author: kingthorin

replies.bodyText: No no, Variant handles the manipulation but AbstractAppParamPlugin calls the scan method for one field at a time hence this new class gives the access to entire variant so that child can manipulate fields as per there need.
replies.author: preetkaran20

replies.bodyText: Ah okay, I see what you're after.
replies.author: kingthorin

replies.bodyText:
Why not change AbstractAppParamPlugin to just expose all parameters if that's what's needed?
e.g. scan(HttpMessage, List<NameValuePair>)
Those interested in all parameters just need to override the method.
Worth noting that variants do not support changing multiple parameters at the same time.
replies.author: thc202

replies.bodyText:
@thc202
Actually if we expose List<NameValuePair> then setParameter/setEscapedParameter method becomes irrelevant as it considers nameValuePair as class variable. Also param plugin was written for some other purpose and having default implementation seems hacky. WDYT ?
Oh variants don't support changing multiple parameters ? because of start index and end index of value getting changed after setparameter is invoked ?
How should be proceed on this ? shall we create a new setParameter method that re-initialise the variant with new message after setting parameter ?
replies.author: preetkaran20

replies.bodyText:
The NameValuePairs are already being exposed through scan(HttpMessage, NameValuePair) (and there are scan rules that make use of it), the only difference is that we would be exposing all of them at once. Those methods would not be irrelevant, they are used by scan rules that scan just one parameter at the same time.
The variants don't keep track of what changes were already done to a given message, the parameters would have to be set at the same time for properly construct the payload.
replies.author: thc202
preetkaran20

replies.bodyText:
I'm not sure it is, e.g. a list allows to add one element or multiple at the same time. If you have multiple parameters you call the method that accepts multiple, if you have one parameter you call the method that accepts one.
Yes, that's what I said in the previous comment, variants don't currently keep track of what changes were done to a given message, the parameters need to be set at the same time.
replies.author: thc202
preetkaran20

replies.bodyText: The proposed methods do not support changing multiple parameters. Probably better to discuss how the variant will support changing multiple parameters instead, that's what actually will define how the plugin will expose that.
replies.author: thc202

replies.bodyText:
There's still no proposal on how to change the parameters at the same time #6371 (comment).

@thc202  Now this PR handles changing multiple parameters. Please look at PR: https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/pull/6371/files#diff-9dfdfe7aed90f3b927955bcfb81a1c9ae34e745c7b5b4e04d79b5b0130cfb12aR241
replies.author: preetkaran20

timeline.bodyText:

This can be done from the setParameter api or by exposing a new api which can handle multiple updates and hence the new Api will not impact the performance of existing setparameter api.
WDYT ?
